page.title: 12LOCAL POLITICS
page.content: The town of Renfrew is in the District of Renfrew in the Region of Strathclyde. It is represented at District level by Mrs Elizabeth McIntosh of the Labour Party. The most pressing issue for her at present is the resistance of people in the Deanpark Housing Estate to proposals to build a sports complex at the Deanpark Hotel. At Regional level the representative is Mr Thomas Graham, also of the Labour Party. The issue of most concern to him at present is the effect of the Conservative Government's public spending cuts on services in Strathclyde coupled with the tripling of rateable values resulting in an avarage rates rise of 30%. Many of the older residents of Renfrew resent the passing of the old Renfrew Burgh autonomy in the reorgan- isation of local government in 1975.
